objectives.objective: Establish a cyber security committee mandated by the board.
Head the cyber security committee with an independent senior manager from a control function.
Include senior managers from relevant departments, Chief Information Security Officer (CISO), and allow Internal Audit as an 'observer' in the cyber security committee.
Develop a cyber security committee charter with objectives, roles, responsibilities, minimum meeting participants, and meeting frequency.
Establish a cyber security function.
Ensure independence of the cyber security function from the IT function with separate reporting lines, budgets, and staff evaluations.
Have the cyber security function report directly to the CEO/managing director or general manager of a control function.
Appoint a full-time senior manager (CISO) at senior management level for the cyber security function.
Ensure CISO has Saudi nationality, is sufficiently qualified, and obtain approval from SAMA.
Define, approve, maintain, and execute the cyber security strategy.
Align the cyber security strategy with the Member Organization’s overall objectives, legal and regulatory compliance, and the Banking Sector’s cyber security strategy.
Address the importance and benefits of cyber security, the anticipated future state, and the execution of cyber security initiatives and projects.
Define, approve, and communicate the cyber security policy.
Review the cyber security policy periodically according to a predefined and structured review process.
Consider the cyber security policy as input for other corporate policies, support it with security standards and procedures, and base it on best practices and (inter)national standards.
Include various elements in the cyber security policy, such as definitions, objectives, responsibilities, reference to supporting standards, requirements, and more.
Board of Directors holds the ultimate responsibility for cyber security, including budget allocation, charter approval, and endorsement of cyber security governance, strategy, and policy.

Responsibilities of the cyber security committee include monitoring and communicating the Member Organization’s cyber security risk appetite, reviewing the cyber security strategy, and approving and supporting various cyber security aspects.

Responsibilities of senior management include ensuring that standards reflect security requirements, promoting acceptance and compliance with the cyber security policy, and incorporating cyber security responsibilities into job descriptions.

Responsibilities of the CISO encompass developing and maintaining various cyber security aspects, ensuring security standards and procedures, delivering risk-based solutions, and overseeing cyber security activities.
Internal audit function's responsibility is to perform cyber security audits.
All Member Organization’s staff are responsible for complying with the cyber security policy, standards, and procedures.
Integrate cyber security into the Member Organization's project management methodology to address cyber security risks in projects.
Ensure that all cyber security initiatives are aligned with the Member Organization’s cyber security strategy.
Incorporate a risk assessment at the start of each project to identify cyber security risks and ensure they are addressed through existing controls or new measures.
Maintain a project-risk register to track cyber security risks, define responsibilities, and conduct a cyber security review.
Perform a cyber security review by an independent internal or external party during the project.
Define, approve, and conduct cyber security awareness programs to promote a positive cyber security culture.
Conduct cyber security awareness programs for staff, third parties, and customers of the Member Organization.
Tailor the cyber security awareness program to address the different target groups through various channels.
Conduct cyber security awareness activities periodically throughout the year.

Include key elements in the cyber security awareness program, such as explanations of cyber security measures, roles and responsibilities, and information on emerging cyber security events and threats.
Evaluate the effectiveness of the cyber security awareness program and formulate recommendations for improvement.
Address customer awareness for both retail and commercial customers, providing them with suggested cyber security mechanisms to mitigate their own risks.

Provide specialist or security-related skills training to staff in relevant functional areas, including key roles, cyber security staff, staff involved in developing and maintaining information assets, and staff involved in risk assessments.
Offer education to equip staff with the skills and knowledge required to securely operate the Member Organization’s information assets.
Define, approve, and implement the cyber security risk management process.
Focus the cyber security risk management process on safeguarding the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information assets.
Align the cyber security risk management process with the existing enterprise risk management process.
Document the cyber security risk management process and address risk identification, analysis, response, and monitoring & review.
Include the Member Organization’s information assets in the cyber security risk management process, such as business processes, applications, and infrastructure components.
Initiate the cyber security risk management process early in projects, prior to critical changes, when outsourcing is considered, and when launching new products and technologies.
Periodically subject existing information assets to cyber security risk assessment based on their classification or risk profile.
Involve business owners, IT specialists, cyber security specialists, and key user representatives in the cyber security risk management activities.
Report the results of the risk assessment to the relevant business owner, who should accept and endorse the results.
Clearly define and formally approve the Member Organization’s cyber security risk appetite and risk tolerance.
Perform cyber security risk identification.
Document identified cyber security risks in a central register, addressing relevant information assets, threats, vulnerabilities, and existing cyber security controls.
Conduct a cyber security risk analysis, considering the level of potential business impact and likelihood of cyber security threat events.
Treat determined cyber security risks in accordance with the Member Organization’s risk appetite and requirements.
Ensure that risk treatment options are documented, including accepting, avoiding, transferring, or mitigating risks through cyber security controls.
For accepted risks, consider predefined limits and gain approval from the business owner to ensure alignment with risk appetite and regulatory compliance.
Avoid unacceptable cyber security risks by deciding to cancel or postpone activities or projects.
Transfer or share cyber security risks with relevant providers, ensure acceptance, and eventually execute the transfer.
Mitigate cyber security risks through the identification, evaluation, selection, and implementation of appropriate cyber security controls.
Document risk treatment actions in a risk treatment plan.
Monitor cyber security risk treatments, track progress, and ensure the implementation of selected controls.
Review the design and effectiveness of revised or newly implemented cyber security controls.

Establish a process for ensuring compliance with relevant regulatory requirements affecting cyber security, involving representatives from key areas of the Member Organization, and updating policies and procedures accordingly.
Ensure compliance with Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS), EMV technical standard, and SWIFT Customer Security Controls Framework - March 2017.
Periodically conduct cyber security reviews for critical information assets.
Subject customer and internet-facing services to annual review and penetration tests.
Record details of cyber security reviews, including results, issues identified, and recommended actions.
Report the results of cyber security reviews to business owners.
Conduct follow-up reviews to ensure that identified issues have been addressed, critical risks have been effectively treated, and agreed actions are being managed on an ongoing basis.
Independently perform cyber security audits according to generally accepted auditing standards and the SAMA cyber security framework.
Conduct cyber security audits in line with the Member Organization’s audit manual and audit plan.
Define, approve, and implement cyber security requirements through the human resources process.
Monitor, measure, and periodically evaluate the effectiveness of the human resources process.

Incorporate cyber security responsibilities and non-disclosure clauses in staff agreements, provide cyber security awareness, define disciplinary actions, conduct screening and background checks, and manage post-employment cyber security activities.
Address for all information assets the mandatory events which should be monitored, based on the classification or risk profile of the information asset.
The security event management process should include requirements for the establishment of a designated team responsible for security monitoring (i.e., Security Operations Center (SOC)).
The security event management process should include requirements for skilled and (continuously) trained staff.
The security event management process should include requirements for a restricted area to facilitate SOC activities and workspaces.
The security event management process should include requirements for resources required for continuous security event monitoring activities (24x7).
The security event management process should include requirements for detection and handling of malicious code and software.
The security event management process should include requirements for detection and handling of security or suspicious events and anomalies.
The security event management process should include requirements for deployment of a security network packet analysis solution.
The security event management process should include requirements for adequately protected logs.
The security event management process should include requirements for periodic compliance monitoring of applications and infrastructure cyber security standards.

The security event management process should include requirements for automated and centralized analysis of security loggings and correlation of event or patterns (i.e., Security Information and Event Management (SIEM)).
The security event management process should include requirements for reporting of cyber security incidents.
The security event management process should include requirements for independent periodic testing of the effectiveness of the security operations center (e.g., red-teaming).
The cyber security incident management process should be defined, approved, implemented, and aligned with the enterprise incident management process.
The effectiveness of the cyber security controls within the cyber security incident management process should be measured and periodically evaluated.
The standard should address the mandatory and suspicious security events which should be responded to.
The security incident management process should include requirements for the establishment of a designated team responsible for security incident management.
The security incident management process should include requirements for skilled and (continuously) trained staff.

The security incident management process should include requirements for sufficient capacity available of certified forensic staff for handling major incidents (e.g., internal staff or contracting an external forensic team).
The security incident management process should include requirements for a restricted area to facilitate the computer emergency response team (CERT) workspaces.
The security incident management process should include requirements for the classification of cyber security incidents.
The security incident management process should include requirements for the timely handling of cyber security incidents, recording and monitoring progress.
The security incident management process should include requirements for the protection of relevant evidence and loggings.
The security incident management process should include requirements for post-incident activities, such as forensics, root-cause analysis of the incidents.
The security incident management process should include requirements for reporting of suggested improvements to the CISO and the Committee.
The security incident management process should include requirements for establishing a cyber security incident repository.
The Member Organization should inform ‘SAMA IT Risk Supervision’ immediately when a medium or high classified security incident has occurred and identified.
The Member Organization should obtain ‘no objection’ from ‘SAMA IT Risk Supervision’ before any media interaction related to the incident.
The threat intelligence management process should be defined, approved and implemented.
The effectiveness of the threat intelligence management process should be measured and periodically evaluated.
The vulnerability management process should be defined, approved and implemented.
The effectiveness of the vulnerability management process should be measured and periodically evaluated.
The cyber security requirements should be defined, approved, implemented and communicated within the contract and vendor management processes.
The compliance with contract and vendor management process should be monitored.
The effectiveness of the cyber security controls within the contract and vendor management process should be measured and periodically evaluated.

The contract management process should cover requirements for:
a. executing a cyber security risk assessment as part of the procurement process;

The contract management process should cover requirements for:
b. defining the specific cyber security requirements as part of the tender process;

The contract management process should cover requirements for:
c. evaluating the replies of potential vendors on the defined cyber security requirements;

The contract management process should cover requirements for:
d. testing of the agreed cyber security requirements (risk-based);

The contract management process should cover requirements for:
e. defining the communication or escalation process in case of cyber security incidents;

The contract management process should cover requirements for:
f. ensuring cyber security requirements are defined for exiting, terminating or renewing the contract (including escrow agreements if applicable);

The contract management process should cover requirements for:
g. defining a mutual confidentiality agreement.

The vendor management process (i.e., service level management) should cover requirements for:
a. periodic reporting, reviewing and evaluating the contractually agreed cyber security requirements (in SLAs).
The cyber security requirements within the outsourcing policy and process should be defined, approved, implemented and communicated within Member Organization.
The cyber security requirements within the outsourcing policy and process should be defined, approved, implemented and communicated within Member Organization.
The cyber security requirements regarding the outsourcing policy and process should be measured and periodically evaluated.
The outsourcing process should include:a. the approval from SAMA prior to material outsourcing;b. the involvement of the cyber security function;c. compliance with the SAMA circular on outsourcing.
The cyber security controls within the cloud computing policy for hybrid and public cloud services should be defined, approved and implemented and communicated within Member Organization.
The compliance with the cloud computing policy should be monitored.
The cyber security controls regarding the cloud computing policy and process for hybrid and public cloud services should be periodically measured and evaluated.

The cloud computing policy for hybrid and public cloud services should address requirements for:a. the process for adopting cloud services, including that:1. a cyber security risk assessment and due diligence on the cloud service provider and its cloud services should be performed;2. the Member Organization should obtain SAMA approval prior to using cloud services or signing the contract with the cloud provider;3. a contract should be in place, including the cyber security requirements, before using cloud services;

b. data location, including that:1. in principle only cloud services should be used that are located in Saudi Arabia, or when cloud services are to be used outside Saudi Arabia that the Member Organization should obtain explicit approval from SAMA;
